extent.measure: The first two folios are numbered 63 and 64. Then foliation starts again from 1 to 144; follows 1 unnumbered folio, folio 145 and one last unnumbered folio.

supportDesc.foliation: Nandināgarī numerals, on the left margin of the recto, 63-64; 1-144; one unnumbered folio; 145; one unnumbered folio.

collation.desc: The first two folios contain the beginning of the 6th aṣṭaka of the Ṛgveda, which supply the missing part in U2. They are numbered 63 and 64.

The leaves are numbered from 1 to 145. Original foliation has been cancelled. f. 133 is missing, but could have been mistakenly inserted between ff. 79 and 80, although the numbering is difficult to read due to multiple foliation with cancellation. One folio is inserted between f. 144 and f. 145. This folio contains the same text as 145r, whose first line is partly thorn and therefore illegible. On f. 121r, l. 6, and v., the text contains some khilāni, following RV 10.127.8. 122r is blank, and the text continues then on 122v with RV 10.128.1.
This is an unnumbered folio written on the verso in Telugu and Nandināgarī. The Telugu is illegible, the completion statement in Nandināgarī is clear.

supportDesc.condition: Mainly good state of preservation, despite some bore holes caused by insects and a few damaged folios. The first two folios (numbered 63-64) are uninked, as well as some folios in the middle.

handNote.desc: Accents are marked. The two folios are uninked
